Text: Desk appearance ticket:  A person who receives a DAT has been arrested.
Triplets:<Desk appearance ticket
2:
--------------------
<Text: Desk appearance ticket:  The DAT is simply one of two alternative means by which a person who is arrested appears for arraignment, or first appearance.>
Triplets:<Desk appearance ticket
3:
--------------------
<Text: Desk appearance ticket:  A person who receives a DAT is permitted to appear in court on their own on the date indicated on the DAT document.>

Triplet:<DAT
4:
--------------------
Text: Desk appearance ticket:  A person who does not receive a DAT is processed through the arrest to arraignment system and is supposed to have their arraignment within 24 hours.
Triplets:<Desk appearance ticket
5:
--------------------
Text: Desk appearance ticket:  From the point that the case is arraigned, a DAT case is like any other criminal case.
Triplets:<Desk appearance ticket

Text: Desk appearance ticket:  If a person fails to return to court on the date indicated on the DAT, the Court will issue an arrest warrant.
